intro: Gonolobus magnifolius, commonly known as the giant flame vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces striking orange-red flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom throughout the year in warm climates. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its vigorous growth habit, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses.
